Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2010 01:40PM Marj2007 wrote: The only suggestion that I can make is the Fentanyl patch.  I have tried the 25mcg and the 50 mcg - the 25 works best for me.  You put it on and replace in three days.  It gives you a steady stream of pain med and I can really tell the difference.  I also had positive results with the oxy but could not seem to take them on time - brain farts!! - so the patch works so much better for me.  I am not sure about the price compared to oxy but they do make a generic patch. Hope this helps, Marjorie

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 04:34AM Marj2007 wrote: Janine, I would just like to add that you need to see your dentist BEFORE you have your first Zometa treatment in case you need any dental work such as having a tooth pulled.  There is a small chance of getting Osteonecrosis (infected jaw bone which would cause the lose of your teeth). I was not told by my Oncologist about this possibility and at the time I was fighting gum disease and my dentist would have pulled a couple of teeth in the back of my mouth if I had gone to him before I started Zometa.  Now I can not have them pulled and must get my teeth cleaned monthly to keep them as healthy as possible.  I am lucky that my dentist has given me a break on the price since I come in every month but even with the price break it has added up over the last 4 years - but I do love to chew so I find the money. Bottom line - Please see your dentist and like everyone else above has said, you will be fine. Good luck, Marjorie
